subject: Love.  Death.  Sex.  Heartbreak.
event: What more could you want? Coming in November, the latest original anthology from me and my sometime-partner, Gardner Dozois (former editor of ASIMOV's and winner of umpty-ump Hugo Awards as our field's best editor): SONGS OF LOVE AND DEATH. The good folks at Pocket Books have just sent us the cover. Have a look. The lineup: -Jim Butcher, "Love Hurts" (a Harry Dresden story) -Jo Beverly, "The Marrying Maid" -Carrie Vaughn, "Rooftops" -M.L.N. Hanover, "Hurt Me" -Cecelia Holland, "Demon Lover" -Melinda M. Snodgrass, "The Wayfarer's Advice" (an Imperials story) -Robin Hobb, "Blue Boots" -Neil Gaiman, "The Thing About Cassandra" -Marjorie M. Liu, "After the Blood" -Jacqueline Carey, "You and You Alone" (a Kushiel story) -Lisa Tuttle, "His Wolf" -Linnea Sinclair, "Courting Trouble" -Mary Jo Putney, "The Demon Dancer" -Tanith Lee, "Under/Above the Water" -Peter S. Beagle, "Kashkia" -Yasmine Galenorn, "Man in the Mirror" -Diana Gabaldon, "A Leaf on the Wind of All Hallows" (an OUTLANDER spinoff) The anthology will be released as a hardcover under the Gallery imprint.

comments.article: You, Gaiman & Gabaldon in one volume?  I may just be in love....
Legends 2
Can hardly wait.
comments.subject: wow

comments.article: Wow!  What a lineup.  I don't often read anthologies, but I'm going to go out of my way for this one.
This.
A story about Delaunay, iirc.

comments.upictitle: I'll be in my bunk: hedgehog squee
comments.article: Definitely adding this one to my list of books to buy this fall
Yay I can't wait to get a copy :D
I really liked Lisa Tuttle in Saved By The Bell.
Any idea if/when it'll be hitting the Antipodes?

Hi Mr Martin

I know this is off topic, but i wasn't sure where to ask it, so I thought I'd ask on your last blog.

I listen to the audio books of Ice and Fire a lot on the way to adn from work, and now they are starting to ware down. Just wondering if they are ever going to come out on CD? Since this day and age tape players are starting to become obsolete.

Thanks for writing such GREAT books.
comments.subject: audio books

comments.article:
They've been available on CD for years:

http://www.booksontape.com/search.cfm?author=19216&media_type=&trans_type=P&short=2

comments.article: Ooh! New reads!

comments.upictitle: Thoughts of a nerdy feminist: pic#124268277
comments.article: Lots of great authors in here. I don't usually do anthologies, but I'll have to make an exception!
...yet an avid reader, much of my reading is done on an ad-hoc free time basis. For this reason, I love anthologies.
comments.subject: As a busy father...

comments.upictitle: ich hab euch etwas mitgebracht: SansaSandor
comments.article: I love anthologies and I'm buying this one right away.  I'm sure you will, but don't forget to let us know when you can preorder it!

It is up at Amazon:

http://www.amazon.com/Songs-Love-Death-George-Martin/dp/1439150141/ref=wl_it_dp_o?ie=UTF8&coliid=IBK9GSV3RE2I1&colid=2W3LM1ETHGFJ4
comments.subject: If you're looking to pre-order it immediately
Re: If you're looking to pre-order it immediately

comments.article: This looks like a good lineup... but does that mean you don't have a story in this one?  I was hoping we might finally see Dunk reunited with Tanselle - but maybe I shouldn't hope for that, since knowing you she'd probably be dead by the end of the story.
Certainly looking forward to this, for the Carey story first and foremost, but Peter Beagle, Neil Gaiman, and Tanith Lee are definite favorites of ours.

I've been a fan of Gaiman's for over 20 years, so I'd be picking this up for him alone. I'm not as familiar with some of the others as I'd like to be, for example I only know Marjorie M. Liu from some of her comic work, but I look forward to becoming more familiar with them come Winter.

Though I am a tad disappointed that there will be no story from you Mr. Martin. I can think of several backstories for Fire & Ice characters that might make for great reading. Cersei and Jaime. Renly and Loras. Ned and Catelyn. Maybe for the follow-up Anthology?
Wow looks to be a great collection, but when I seen Jaquelin Carey on there I was SOLD!!! Loved her Sundering series!

comments.upictitle: ...and my axe!!!: berserk - guts - happy happy joy joy!
comments.article: Okay, anyone who first associates Carey with the Sundering is totally hearted in my book.  <3

Looks like it should be a great anthology.

Just curious, you stopped updating on the suvudu cage matches and all. Jaime has gone through the last round you wrote about and through another one to the quarter finals, I'm sure you knew all this, however any chance on another right up?
comments.subject: Book/Suvudu

comments.article:
Stories by Jim Butcher and Neil Gaiman, in a book edited in part by George R. R. Martin?

...my life is now complete. Seriously. Someone once asked me if I could have dinner and talk shop with three authors, who would they be, and those were my answers. Awesome.

Ouuu, I'll have to put this on my Christmas wish list... or just buy
myself a gift... XD
Thanks for the heads-up on this! New Gaiman, Butcher, Gabaldon, Beagle and Lee all in one place ... very exciting.
hey lets not forget about Jaime in the cage match. He's currently losing by about 100 votes.

George,

Your man Jamie is starting lose ground on Suvudu now that Pat Rothfuss has posted his account of the battle. Let's not let our favorite one-handed knight lose! Come on, Kvothe is a manic depressed innkeeper! Jamie was smoking him until Rothfuss said his part. Get out there an vote people.
comments.subject: Jamie is going to lose if you dont write a rebuttal!

comments.article:
Who would have thought Jaime could be outdone by that?
I voted for Jaime, but I have to admit- Jaime would struggle for that win. Any chance for a Jaime VS Kvothe piece? The Jaime/Cthulu was quite a fan fave.

And another DANCE tease/update would be most welcome, too....

Looking forward to checking out your new anthology- Jacqueline Carey is awesome.
comments.subject: Jaime's final undoing

comments.article: Oh no, we can't have Jaime lose to that lute plinger.
